subject: Re: [junit] Run same test method with different data
msgSnippet: ... This is what I mean. No inner classes. ... Sure they are. Overriding runTest() doesn t affect whether runBare() invokes setUp() and tearDown(). It s just
messageBody:
Ray Tayek wrote:

> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> > Sent: Friday, March 26, 2004 5:12 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [junit] Run same test method with different data
> >
> >
> > Ray Tayek wrote:
> >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> > > > Sent: Friday, March 19, 2004 12:54 PM
> > > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > > Subject: Re: [junit] Run same test method with different data ...
> > > > Jacqueline Guerrero wrote:
> > > > > Is there a way to run a testXXX()...
> > > > You appear to want to create a Parameterized Test Case.
> > Search the
> > > > archives of this group for more information. ...
> > >
> > > Found that. It uses an inner class. Works great ...
> >
> > I have never recommended using inner classes for this kind of
> > thing. I find it unnecessarily complicated.
>
> Hmmm, I found what I thought was your reply to someone while searching the
> arhive for "Parameterized Test Case", but I did not go far enough. I guess
> the stuff you were referring to starts around:
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/9954

This is what I mean. No inner classes.

> I did notice that the setup and teardown were not called before and after
> the inner tests were run :(

Sure they are. Overriding runTest() doesn't affect whether runBare()
invokes setUp() and tearDown(). It's just that with PTC you generally
don't need them.

> Thanks for contibuting your work on the subject.

You're welcome.
